overview: From 2025-10-01 to 2025-11-01, Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore had 8 new PRs (7 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: Initial plugin implementation
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Initial implementation of the CryptoScore plugin for ElizaOS
- Token score retrieval functionality
- Wallet scores analysis
- Service integration with CryptoScore API

## Features
- Get token scores by address or symbol
- Get wallet scores and analysis
- LLM-friendly response formatting

topPRs.title: feat(workflows): add release management and NPM publishing workflows
topPRs.author: M4XGO
topPRs.body:
- Created .release-please-manifest.json to define the release version.
- Added release-please-config.json for release type and changelog configuration.
- Implemented GitHub Actions workflows for automated NPM publishing and release management.


## How : 
Using : https://github.com/Sendo-labs/reusable-workflows/pull/1 to test

topContributors.summary: Neysixx: Drove a significant refactoring effort within the Sendo-labs/frontend repository, merging two substantial pull requests that restructured the project. Their largest contribution, PR #1, overhauled the project structure and configurations with over 17k lines added and 16k removed, while PR #3 improved the pages structure. This work, totaling over 36k lines added and 33k removed across 636 files, reflects a primary focus on large-scale refactoring and feature development.

standujar: Focused on foundational work this month, establishing several new projects and features across the Sendo-labs organization. They delivered significant impact by creating the initial implementation for a new plugin in Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore#1 (+2548 lines) and setting up the entire frontend project in Sendo-labs/frontend#2 (+2814 lines). Additionally, they initialized a new contributor tracking system in Sendo-labs/leaderboard#1. This activity shows a primary focus on feature work and other foundational tasks, with changes concentrated in code and configuration files.

M4XGO: This month, M4XGO focused on establishing foundational CI/CD infrastructure for the Sendo-labs organization. They opened a significant pull request to create reusable workflows and manage releases (Sendo-labs/reusable-workflows#1). This single initiative involved over 1000 lines of new code across 15 files, primarily consisting of documentation and configuration changes.

xdrkush: This month, xdrkush's efforts were focused on initiating the new `sendo-api` repository. They landed a single, substantial pull request (Sendo-labs/sendo-api#1) which introduced the project's foundational structure with over 21,000 lines of code. This initial commit consisted primarily of application code and configuration files, establishing the groundwork for the new service.

0xCanet: This month, 0xCanet established the foundational codebase for the new `Sendo-labs/frontend` repository. Their work consisted of a single, significant pull request (#1), which served as the initial commit and introduced over 9,200 lines of code to bootstrap the project.

0domart: Focused on implementing new functionality in the Sendo-labs/spotlight repository, opening a significant pull request (#1) to add SOL transfer logic. This work involved a substantial code contribution (+1527/-617 lines), with the changes indicating a primary focus on building out comprehensive unit tests for this new feature.

tionebDotsamapha: This month, their activity centered on documentation improvements for the Sendo-labs/sendo-api repository. They opened a pull request (#2) to update the project's README file and also contributed one comment on a pull request.
